perturbation.original_text:
WHEREAS, the Funds’ shares may be sold by broker-dealers registered with the Securities and Exchange Commission (the “SEC”) and
the Financial Industry Regulatory Authority (“FINRA”); and
WHEREAS, the Distributor wishes to retain S2K, through registered representatives of S2K (“Authorized S2K Representatives”), to
introduce the Funds to registered representatives of broker-dealers and registered investment advisers located at the financial institutions (each, an
“Intermediary” and collectively, “Intermediaries”) that may have customers interested in investing in a Fund.
perturbation.changed_text:
WHEREAS, the Funds’ shares may be sold by broker-dealers registered with the Securities and Exchange Commission (the “SEC”) but registration with
the Financial Industry Regulatory Authority (“FINRA”) is optional; and
WHEREAS, the Distributor wishes to retain S2K, through registered representatives of S2K (“Authorized S2K Representatives”), to
introduce the Funds to unregistered representatives of broker-dealers and registered investment advisers located at the financial institutions (each, an
“Intermediary” and collectively, “Intermediaries”) that may have customers interested in investing in a Fund.
perturbation.explanation: The original text states shares may be sold by broker-dealers registered with the SEC and FINRA, but the modified text creates a contradiction stating that FINRA registration is optional. This is a misaligned terminology contradiction because FINRA registration is not optional for broker-dealers under US securities laws. The second change replaces 'registered representatives' with 'unregistered representatives' which contradicts the regulatory requirements for selling securities.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Securities Exchange Act of 1934, FINRA rules

perturbation.original_text:
S2K will market the Funds to Intermediaries that:
(a) are registered as “broker-dealers” with the SEC, FINRA, and any other applicable jurisdiction in which they operate and are
required to be so registered by law;
perturbation.changed_text:
S2K will market the Funds to Intermediaries that:
(a) may or may not be registered as “broker-dealers” with the SEC and other jurisdictions, FINRA registration is at their own discretion.
perturbation.explanation: The modified text contradicts the legal requirement for broker-dealers to be registered with both the SEC and FINRA. By stating that registration may or may not be necessary and making FINRA registration discretionary, the contract deviates from established securities regulations.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Securities Exchange Act of 1934, FINRA rules

perturbation.original_text:
(xi) It and Authorized S2K Representatives are and will use best efforts to remain properly registered with and licensed
by the SEC and are and will use best efforts to remain members in good standing of FINRA or any relevant subsidiary thereof, as
applicable;
perturbation.changed_text:
(xi) It and Authorized S2K Representatives have the option to register or be licensed
by the SEC or other bodies and there is no requirement to be members or in good standing of FINRA or any relevant subsidiary thereof.
perturbation.explanation: The original text correctly states that S2K and its representatives must be registered with the SEC and be members of FINRA. The modified version suggests that registration is optional and membership with FINRA is not a requirement, directly contradicting securities regulations. Registration and proper licensing is mandatory.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Securities Exchange Act of 1934, FINRA rules
